all_response:
Jax: I've heard it's easy to dig up artifacts in mines. But you need to go to the store and buy a metal detector to determine the exact location of the artifacts.
Jax: The only place you can buy a metal detector is the adventurers store.
Jax: You can trick the monsters into falling asleep to get into the mines.
Jax: You can go to the store to buy chicken legs laced with sleeping medicine and leave this for the monsters to eat. You can then sneak in when they fall asleep.
Jax: This kind of chicken leg is only sold in the Hunter's Store.
Jax: You should not use an excavator for digging as it might damage the artifacts. You should use a small shovel for digging instead so you can dig carefully.
Jax: Only the North Mine is easy to dig up artifacts. The West Mine will be too challenging for you to dig up artifacts on your own.

all_response_exaplain: The previous responses from Jax did not explain where to buy a metal detector. This response addresses the question of where to buy a metal detector, specifying that it should be purchased from the Adventurers Store. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the lack of information on where to buy a metal detector.

Jax previously mentioned that the entrance to the mines is guarded by monsters but did not explain how to get past them. This response addresses how to get past the monsters or alleviates concerns about being unable to enter the mines. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the issue of being unable to enter the mines.

Jax mentioned that tricking the monsters into falling asleep is a way to get into the mines but did not explain how to do so. This response addresses how to make the monsters fall asleep or answers questions about the method of making them fall asleep. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the lack of information on how to make the monsters fall asleep.

Jax mentioned that buying chicken legs laced with sleeping medicine is necessary to make the monsters fall asleep but did not clarify where to buy them. This response addresses the question of where to buy the chicken legs, specifying that they should be purchased from the Hunter's Store and not other stores. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple stores and is unsure which one to choose.

There are two digging skills in the game. This response addresses the question of which digging skill to use, specifying that the small shovel should be used instead of the excavator to avoid damaging the artifacts. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple digging skills and is unsure which one to use for digging.

There are two mines in the game scenario, and the previous response did not specify which mine to dig for artifacts. This response addresses the question of which mine to go to, specifying that it should be the North Mine and not the West Mine. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple mines and is unsure which one to go.

all_response:
Jax: You can go to the mine to dig for rubies, but you must stun the monster to enter the mine.
Jax: You can use the vacuum sucker to collect mist from the forest to stun the monsters, then go to the mine and release the mist to stun the mine monsters. When you enter the forest, turn on the vacuum sucker to absorb the mist, and then go to the mine to release the air from the vacuum sucker to stun the monsters. Remember to wear a gas mask when releasing the mist.
Jax: You can collect mists in Fantasy Forest. The Miasma Forest and the Mist Forest don't have the mists you need. You should also remember to bring a gas mask when you enter the Fantasy Forest.
Jax: The North Mine is a ruby mine, so you should go there to excavate for them.
Jax: The rubies are located deep underground so you will need to use an excavator to dig for rubies in the mine.

all_response:
Jax: Your task is to excavate artifacts in the ancient cemetery. The first step of the excavation work is to set up a work area, using store-bought tents for this purpose. Then, you can start excavating, but you must use correct excavation tools to ensure the integrity of the artifacts. Once you have finished excavating, the artifacts should be sent to laboratory for analysis and preservation.
Jax: Tents can be bought at Henry's Department Store, as this is the only place nearby where tents suitable for archeology are sold.
Jax: You need to send the excavated artifacts to the Royal Archaeological Laboratory, who are responsible for funding the dig and carrying out the research.
Jax: Only use a small shovel for excavation, as other tools could easily damage artifacts.
Jax: Your mission is to go to the East Mountain Cemetery Group, as the other tomb complexes have already been excavated and analyzed by other archaeologists.

all_response:
Jax: You need to go to the mine to excavate spirit stones. After you have dug up the spirit stones, place them in a suitable box and take them back to the laboratory to give to Professor Henry.
Jax: The monsters are asleep every night from 8 PM to 12 AM. You can take this opportunity to enter the mine.
Jax: The East Mine is rich in spirit stones so you should go there to dig for them. 
Jax: The spirit stones are located deep underground so you will need to use an excavator to dig for stones in the mine. 
Jax: You need to use a wooden box to carry the spirit stones. The stones carry an unnatural heat, which the wooden box will insulate against without burning, but the iron box will not.
Jax: Professor Henry works at the Royal Laboratory, and you should go there to find him.

all_response:
Jax: You need to dig a trap to capture the monster that has been causing destruction in the town. The trap should be dug in the forest and should be cylindrical, 1 meter wide, and 2 meters deep. After the trap has been dug, place energy fruits that the monster likes to eat so as to lure it into the trap.
Jax: You should dig a trap by the lake in the forest, because the monster often comes here to drink water.
Jax: Tools for digging the trap can only be bought at Lily's Grocery Store.
Jax: Energy fruits can be bought at the Sky Grocery Store.

all_response_exaplain: The previous responses from Jax did not explain where to obtain the tools needed for digging the trap. This response addresses the question of where to buy the excavation tools, specifying that they can be purchased at Lily's Grocery Store for 300 gold coins. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the issue of needing tools for digging the trap and is unsure where to obtain them.

Jax previously mentioned that energy fruits are needed to lure the monster but did not explain where to buy them. This response addresses the question of where to buy the energy fruits, specifying that they can be purchased at the Sky Grocery Store for 300 gold coins. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the lack of information on where to obtain the energy fruits.

There is a need to ensure that you have enough gold coins to buy both the digging tools and the energy fruits. This response addresses the question of how to obtain the additional gold coins needed, specifying that you can sell the energy crystals in your backpack for 100 gold coins, which will give you just enough money. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the issue of not having enough gold coins to buy both items.

Jax mentioned that a trap needs to be dug but did not specify the dimensions of the trap. This response addresses the question of the appropriate size for the trap, specifying that it should be a cylindrical trap that is 1 meter wide and 2 meters deep. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the lack of information on the size of the trap.

There are multiple locations in the game where the trap could potentially be dug. This response addresses the question of the best location to dig the trap, specifying that it should be dug by the lake in the forest because the monster often comes there to drink water. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple potential locations and is unsure which one to choose.

all_response:
Jax: Your task is to excavate artifacts in the ancient cemetery. The first step of the excavation work is to set up a work area, using store-bought tents for this purpose. Then, you can start excavating, but you must use correct excavation tools to ensure the integrity of the artifacts.
Jax: To enter the cemetery, you need to go to the archaeological laboratory first and obtain an archaeological work permit from Professor Henry.
Jax: Professor Henry can be found at the Royal Archaeological Laboratory where he works.
Jax: Tents can be bought at Sam's Department Store, as this is the only place nearby where tents suitable for archeology are sold.
Jax: Only use a small shovel for excavation, as other tools could easily damage artifacts.
Jax: Your mission is to go to the East Mountain Tombs, as the other tomb complexes have already been excavated and analyzed by other archaeologists.

all_response_exaplain: The previous responses from Jax did not explain how to enter the cemetery. There are multiple tomb complexes in the game scenario, and the previous response did not specify which tomb complex to excavate. This response addresses the question of which tomb complex to go to, specifying that it should be the East Mountain Tombs and not the West, South, or North Mountain Tombs. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple tomb complexes and is unsure which one to go.
